event.name: Drains

event.title: Write Buffer
event.name: Write Merges
event.description: Buffered write merged in a store buffer slot

event.title: Core
event.name: Cycle counter
event.description: An increment each cycle

event.name: Cycles

event.name: Inst miss

event.description: Branch mis-predicted

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access

event.name: Data miss
event.description: Data cache miss, not including Cache Operations

event.name: Write-back

event.name: SW change

event.title: Cache
event.name: TLB miss
event.description: Main TLB miss (unused on ARM1156)

event.title: External
event.name: Access
event.description: Explicit external data or peripheral access

event.title: Cache
event.name: Stall
event.description: Stall because of Load Store Unit request queue being full

event.title: Write Buffer
event.name: Drains
event.description: The number of times the Write Buffer was drained because of a Data Synchronization Barrier command or Strongly Ordered operation

event.title: Disable Interrupts
event.name: FIQ
event.description: The number of cycles which FIQ interrupts are disabled (ARM1156 only)

event.title: Disable Interrupts
event.name: IRQ
event.description: The number of cycles which IRQ interrupts are disabled (ARM1156 only)

event.title: ETM
event.name: ETMEXTOUT[0]
event.description: ETMEXTOUT[0] signal was asserted for a cycle

event.description: ETMEXTOUT[1] signal was asserted for a cycle

event.title: ETM
event.name: ETMEXTOUT[0,1]
event.description: ETMEXTOUT[0] or ETMEXTOUT[1] was asserted

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Calls
event.description: Procedure call instruction executed

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Returns
event.description: Procedure return instruction executed

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return and predicted
event.description: Procedure return instruction executed and return address predicted

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return and mispredicted
event.description: Procedure return instruction executed and return address predicted incorrectly

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst tag or parity error
event.description: Instruction cache Tag or Valid RAM parity error (ARM1156 only)

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst parity error
event.description: Instruction cache RAM parity error (ARM1156 only)

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data tag or parity error
event.description: Data cache Tag or Valid RAM parity error (ARM1156 only)

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data parity error
event.description: Data cache RAM parity error (ARM1156 only)

event.title: ITCM
event.name: Error
event.description: ITCM error (ARM1156 only)

event.title: DTCM
event.name: Error
event.description: DTCM error (ARM1156 only)

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return address pop
event.description: Procedure return address popped off the return stack (ARM1156 only)

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return address misprediction
event.description: Procedure return address popped off the return stack has been incorrectly predicted by the PFU (ARM1156 only)

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data dirty parity error
event.description: Data cache Dirty RAM parity error (ARM1156 only)

event.title: Atrace
event.name: Window manager
event.description: Window manager

event.title: Atrace
event.name: Activity manager
event.description: Activity manager

event.title: Atrace
event.name: Sync manager
event.description: Sync manager

event.title: Clock
event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed - Software increment

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: L1 instruction cache refill

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: L1 instruction TLB refill

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: L1 data cache refills. This counter only counts refills that cause a new miss to be processed by the L2/memory system. If the miss is satisfied by a previous miss, it is not counted. This refill counter counts both LD misses and PREF misses.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: L1 data cache access. Does not include I/O operations.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: L1 data TLB refill

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Data Read
event.description: Architecturally executed load

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Memory write
event.description: Architecturally executed store. Includes DC ZVA.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Architecturally executed exception return

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Architecturally executed write to CONTEXTIDR

event.title: Branch
event.name: PC change
event.description: Architecturally executed software change of PC

event.title: Branch
event.name: Immediate
event.description: Architecturally executed immediate branch. Specifically counts - B, B.cond, BL, CBNZ, CBZ, TBNZ, TBZ

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Architecturally executed procedure return

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access
event.description: Architecturally executed unaligned load or store

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Mispredicted or not predicted branch (speculatively executed)

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Predictable branch (speculative executed)

event.title: Memory
event.name: Memory access
event.description: Data memory access (PA<47>=0), does not include tables walks, cache maintenance. The access maybe cache hit or miss.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 inst access
event.description: L1 instruction cache access. Counts both hits and misses.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data access
event.description: Number of level 2 data cache accesses. The counter counts memory-read or memory-write operations, that the PE made, that access at least the level 2 data or unified cache. Each access to a cache line is counted including refills of the level 1 data and instruction and writes from the write buffer. Each access to other level 2 data or unified memory structures, such as refill buffers, write buffers, and write-back buffers, is also counted. The counter does not count operations made by other PEs that share this cache, nor CP15 cache maintenance instructions.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data refill
event.description: L2 data cache refills due to this AP. Counts all refills from the L2 to the icache, dcache and pwc.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data write
event.description: L2 data cache write-back due to actions by this AP.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Error
event.description: Local memory error - number of parity errors coming from the icache.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Speculative
event.description: Instruction speculatively executed

event.title: Memory
event.name: Translation table
event.description: Architecturally executed write to translation table base

event.title: Bus
event.name: Cycle
event.description: Bus cycle

event.title: Counter chain
event.name: Odd
event.description: For odd-numbered counters, counts once for each overflow of the preceding even-numbered counter

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 data cache allocation
event.description: L1 data cache allocation without refill

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data cache allocation
event.description: L2 data cache allocation without refill

event.title: Branch
event.name: BR_RETIRED
event.description: Counts number of branches retired that are one of conditional, unconditional, branch and link, return and eret.

event.title: Branch
event.name: BR_MIS_PRED_RETIRED
event.description: Number of branches counted by BR_RETIRED that were not correctly predicted (and therefore have an associated performance loss).

event.title: Other
event.name: STALL_FRONTEND
event.description: Cycles on which no operation issued because there are instructions from the fetch unit.

event.title: Other
event.name: STALL_BACKEND
event.description: Cycles on which no operation instructions issued, even though instructions are available from the fetch unit. Possible reasons include functional unit resource conflicts, data cache misses and similar causes.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L1D_TLB
event.description: Number of accesses to microtlb caused by a data reference. TLB maintenance instructions do not count.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L1I_TLB
event.description: Number of accesses to microtlb caused by an instruction reference.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2I_CACHE
event.description: Number of accesses made to the L2 by the L1 ICache misses.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2I_CACHE_REFILL
event.description: Number of refills into the L2 destined for the icache.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L2D_TLB_REFILL
event.description: Number of MTLB Refills due to memory read and memory write operations.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L2I_TLB_REFILL
event.description: Number of MTLB refills due to instruction TLB misses.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L2D_TLB
event.description: Number of MTLB accesses due to memory read or memory write operations.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1D_CACHE_LD
event.description: Number of level 1 data cache access-read operations (can be hit or miss).

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1D_CACHE_ST
event.description: Number of level 1 data cache access-write operations. This counts stores that can either hit or miss in the dcache.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL_LD
event.description: Number of level 1 data cache refill - read operations caused by LD* instructions, does not include PREF. Counts refills that cause a new miss to be processed by the L2/memory system. If the miss is satisfied by a previous miss, it is not counted.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1D_CACHE_INVAL
event.description: Number of level 1 data cache invalidates caused event outside the core.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L1D_TLB_REFILL_LD
event.description: Number of level 1 data TLB refill (as in L1D_TLB_REFILL) and due to memory read operations.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L1D_TLB_REFILL_ST
event.description: Number of level 1 data TLB refill (as in L1D_TLB_REFILL) and due to memory write operations.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L1D_TLB_LD
event.description: Number of level 1 data TLB access due to memory read operations..

event.title: Memory
event.name: L1D_TLB_ST
event.description: Number of level 1 data access memory write operations.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2D_CACHE_LD
event.description: Number of accesses to L2 cache caused by memory read operations (load instructions, page table walks). Similar to 0x16 but does not include memory write operations or instruction misses.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2D_CACHE_ST
event.description: Number of accesses to L2 cache caused by memory write operations (stores from the write buffer). Similar to 0x16 but does not include memory read operations or instruciton misses.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL_LD
event.description: Number of accesses to L2 cache caused by memory read operations (load instructions, page table walks) that result in an L2 refill (miss).

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL_ST
event.description: Number of access to L2 cache caused by memory write operations (stores from the write buffer) that result in an L2 refill.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2D_CACHE_WB_VICTIM
event.description: Number of accesses to L2 cache that caused a writeback to occur from the L2.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2D_CACHE_WB_CLEAN
event.description: Number of accesses to L2 cache that replaced a cache line that was not dirty.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L2D_TLB_REFILL_LD
event.description: Number of MTLB accesses that miss in the MTLB and were caused by memory read operations.

event.title: Memory
event.name: L2D_TLB_REFILL_ST
event.description: Number of MTLB accesses that miss in the MTLB and were caused by memory write operation.

event.title: Memory
event.name: UNALIGNED_LD_SPEC
event.description: Number of speculative unaligned loads. A load might be counted multiple times due to replays.

event.title: Memory
event.name: UNALIGNED_ST_SPEC
event.description: Number of speculative unaligned stores. A store might be counted multiple times due to replays.

event.title: Memory
event.name: UNALIGNED_LDST_SPEC
event.description: Number of speculative unaligned load or unaligned stores. These unaligned loads and stores might be counted multiple times due to replays.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: LDREX_SPEC
event.description: Number of speculative load exclusives.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: STREX_PASS_SPEC
event.description: Number of speculative store exclusive passes. might be counted multiple times due to replays.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: STREX_FAIL_SPEC
event.description: Number of speculative store exclusive fails. Might be counted multiple times due to replays.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: LD_SPEC
event.description: Number of load instructions; same instructions as 0x6, but speculatively executed, instructions may be counted multiple times due to replays.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: ST_SPEC
event.description: Number of store instructions; same instructions as 0x7, but speculatively executed, instructions may be counted multiple times due to replays.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: LDST_SPEC
event.description: Number of load or store instructions; speculatively executed, instructions may be counted multiple times due to replays.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DP_SPEC
event.description: Number of data processing instructions; speculatively executed (see ARM ARM v8 for definition of this instruction class.)

event.title: Instruction
event.name: ASE_SPEC
event.description: Number of SIMD, speculatively executed (see v8 ARM ARM for definition of this class).

event.title: Instruction
event.name: VFP_SPEC
event.description: Number of FP, speculatively executed (see v8 ARM ARM for definition of this class). Includes FP SIMD instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CRYPTO_SPEC
event.description: Number of crypto instructions (excpet PMUJLL and VMULL) speculatively executed. see v8 ARM ARM for definition of this class.

event.title: Branch
event.name: BR_IMMED_SPEC
event.description: Number of branch with immediate.

event.title: Branch
event.name: BR_RETURN_SPEC
event.description: Number of branch returns.

event.title: Branch
event.name: BR_INDIRECT_SPEC
event.description: Number of indirect branches.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: ISB_SPEC
event.description: Number of isb instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DSB_SPEC
event.description: Number of dsb instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DMB_SPEC
event.description: Number of dmb instruction.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_UNDEF
event.description: Number of undefined instruction synchronous exceptions taken to the default EL (i.e. locally taken). Includes all exceptions with EC=0x0 to EL1 or same EL.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_SVC
event.description: Number of SVC exceptions taken to the default EL (i.e. locally taken). Includes all exceptions with EC=0x15.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_PABORT
event.description: Number of instruction aborts taken to the default EL (i.e. locally taken). Includes all exceptions with EC=0x20,0x21.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_DABORT
event.description: Number of data aborts or errors taken to the default EL (i.e. locally taken).

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_IRQ
event.description: Number of irq exceptions taken to the default EL (i.e. locally taken). Includes VIRQ.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_FIQ
event.description: Number of fiq exceptions taken to the default EL (i.e. locally taken). Includes FIRQ.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_SMC
event.description: Number of system monitor call exceptions taken locally. Does not count SMC exceptions that are trapped to the hypervisor. Includes all exceptions with EC=0x17.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_HVC
event.description: Number of hypervisor call exceptions taken locally. The counter counts for both hypervisor call exception taken locally in the hypervisor and as exceptions from nonsecure EL1. Includes all exceptions with EC=0x16.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_TRAP_PABORT
event.description: Number of instruction aborts not taken locally (i.e. not taken to the default EL).

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_TRAP_DABORT
event.description: Number of data aborts not taken locally (i.e. not taken to the default EL).

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_TRAP_OTHER
event.description: Number of not taken locally exceptions (i.e. not taken to the default EL) that are not covered by other counters counting non locally taken exceptions. Includes all exceptions to EL2 or EL3 from a lower level.

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_TRAP_IRQ
event.description: Number of irq exceptions not taken locally exceptions (i.e. not taken to the default EL).

event.title: Exception
event.name: EXC_TRAP_FIQ
event.description: Number of fiq exceptions not taken locally exceptions (i.e. not taken to the default EL).

event.title: Instruction
event.name: RC_LD_SPEC
event.description: Number of load-aquire instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: RC_ST_SPEC
event.description: Number of store-release instructions.

event.title: Other
event.name: ISSUE_ECLK
event.description: Cycles issue eclk is active (ie not gated).

event.title: Other
event.name: ISSUE
event.description: Number of instructions issued.

event.title: Other
event.name: NISSUE
event.description: Cycles no instructions were issued.

event.title: Other
event.name: SISSUE
event.description: Cycles one instruction was issued.

event.title: Other
event.name: DISSUE
event.description: Cycles two instructions were issued.

event.title: Branch
event.name: BR_FOLDED
event.description: Number of branch instructions that were folded and committed.

event.title: Branch
event.name: BR_FOLDED_SPEC
event.description: Number of branch instructions that were folded and issued but not necessarily committed. Added in pass 2.0.

event.title: Memory
event.name: REPLAY
event.description: Number of mem replays.

event.title: Memory
event.name: IUNA
event.description: Number of operations taking an unaligned replay, these may be speculative. Generally this is a 8 cycle penalty.

event.title: Other
event.name: TRAP
event.description: Number of traps. These include mem replays and exceptions but not mispredicts or unaligned replays

event.title: Memory
event.name: ULOAD
event.description: Number of committed loads which used the unaligned flow. Similar to UNALIGNED_LD_SPEC but this counter counts only committed loads.

event.title: Memory
event.name: USTORE
event.description: Number of committed stores which used the unaligned flow. Similar to UNALIGNED_ST_SPEC but this counter counts only committed stores.

event.title: Cache
event.name: IPREF_LDI
event.description: Number of Icache fills sent to memory subsystem due to a software instruction prefetch. These may be dropped and not result in a subsequent fill.

event.title: Cache
event.name: IFILL
event.description: Number of Icache fills. Noncacheable pseudo fills are not counted. - same as ARM counter 0x0001.

event.title: Cache
event.name: II
event.description: Number of Icache invalidates. Includes all reasons that icache may be invalidated.

event.title: Cache
event.name: IP
event.description: Number of Icache parity errors.

event.title: Cache
event.name: CIMISS
event.description: Cycles idle due to imiss. However, if an iprefetch is already active, the machine must wait for the iprefetch to return before starting the imiss. These lost cycles are not counted.

event.title: Cache
event.name: WBUF
event.description: Number of write buffer entries created.

event.title: Cache
event.name: WDAT
event.description: Number of cycles on the XMD bus which are used to transfer data from the writebuffer to the L2C.

event.title: Cache
event.name: WBUFLD
event.description: Number of write buffer entries forced out by loads.

event.title: Cache
event.name: WBUFFL
event.description: Number of cycles that there was no available write buffer entry.

event.title: Cache
event.name: WBUFTR
event.description: Number of stores that found no available write buffer entries.

event.title: Cache
event.name: CDMISS
event.description: Cycles that don't issue an instruction because the memory system is busy. This include dcache miss cycles, but also includes cycles due to uTLB misses, page table walks and write buffer full stalls. In addition, there is a fixed overhead for recovering from each dcache miss. The following formula may be used to calculate the effective memory latency: latency = [(CDMISS - L1D_TLB_REFILL * 12) - WBUFFL + (L1D_CACHE_REFILL * 8)]/L1D_CACHE_REFILL

event.title: Branch
event.name: ERET_MIS
event.description: Number of committed eret's that mispredict.

event.title: Other
event.name: MSR_HAZTR
event.description: Number of hazard pipeline flushes.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1D_CACHE_MISS_ST
event.description: Number of stores that miss in the dcache. Similar to ARM house style L1D_CACHE_REFILL_ST (0x043) but we don't allocate on store misses.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1D_CACHE_PREF
event.description: Number of dcache prefetch instructions.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL_PREF
event.description: Number of level 1 data cache refill-prefetch misses. Counts refills that cause a new miss to be processed by the L2/memory system. If the miss is satisfied by a previous miss, it is not counted.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1I_CACHE_PREF
event.description: Number of icache prefetch instructions.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1I_CACHE_REFILL_PREF
event.description: Number of icache prefetch instructions that miss.

event.title: Other
event.name: ISSUE_CSRCLK
event.description: Cycles issue csr clk is active (ie not gated).

event.title: Other
event.name: THROTTLE_OFF
event.description: Cycles execution is prevented to reduce power.

event.title: Memory
event.name: LD_NORM_IO
event.description: Number of committed load instructions to Normal memory - I/O space (PA<47>=1).

event.title: Memory
event.name: ST_NORM_IO
event.description: Number of committed store instructions to Normal memory - I/ O space (PA<47>=1).

event.title: Memory
event.name: LD_NORM_MEM
event.description: Number of committed load instructions to Normal memory - MEM space (PA<47>=0).

event.title: Memory
event.name: ST_NORM_MEM
event.description: Number of committed store instructions to Normal memory - MEM space (PA<47>=0).

event.title: Memory
event.name: LD_DEV_IO
event.description: Number of committed load instructions to Device memory - I/O space (PA<47>=1).

event.title: Memory
event.name: ST_DEV_IO
event.description: Number of committed store instructions to Device memory - I/O space (PA<47>=1).

event.title: Memory
event.name: LD_DEV_MEM
event.description: Number of committed load instructions to Device memory - MEM space (PA<47>=0).

event.title: Memory
event.name: ST_DEV_MEM
event.description: Number of committed store instructions to Device memory - MEM space (PA<47>=0).

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB_REFILL_TTBR0_ELX
event.description: Number of stage 1 MTLB misses TTBR0. Can filter by EL level and security state.

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB_REFILL_TTBR1_ELX
event.description: Number of stage 1 MTLB misses TRBR1. Can filter by EL level (EL1 and EL2 - ARMv8.1).

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB_REFILL_VTTBR_EL2
event.description: Number of stage 2 MTLB misses. Only makes sense for EL0 and EL1.

event.title: Memory
event.name: PTW_CYCLES
event.description: Number of cycles PageTable Walker is active.

event.title: Other
event.name: GLBL_SYNC
event.description: Number of global syncs broadcast from this core.

event.title: Other
event.name: SEV
event.description: Number of SEV instructions executed.

event.title: Other
event.name: IC_IALLUX
event.description: Number of IC IALLU and IC IALLUIS executed.

event.title: Other
event.name: IC_IVAU
event.description: Number of IC IVAU executed.

event.title: Other
event.name: IC_IALLU_RCVD
event.description: Number of IC IALLUIS received.

event.title: Other

event.title: CCI-400
event.name: Read stall: tracker full

event.name: Read Stall: Low Priority

event.title: CCI-400
event.name: Read Stall: Medium Priority
event.description: A read request with a QoS value in the medium priority group is stalled for a cycle because there are no slots available in the read queue for the medium priority group

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: Cache Miss
event.description: Counts the total cache misses. This is the first time lookup result, and is high priority.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: L3 SF Cache Access
event.description: Counts the number of cache accesses. This is the first time access, and is high priority.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: Cache Fill
event.description: Counts the total allocations in the HN L3 cache, and all cache line allocations to the L3 cache.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: POCQ Retry
event.description: Counts the number of requests that have been retried.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: POCQ Reqs Recvd
event.description: Counts the number of requests received by HN.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: SF Hit
event.description: Counts the number of snoop filter hits.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: SF Evictions
event.description: Counts the number of snoop filter evictions. Cache invalidations are initiated.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: Snoops Sent
event.description: Counts the number of snoops sent. Does not differentiate between broadcast or directed snoops.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: Snoops Broadcast
event.description: Counts the number of snoop broadcasts sent.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: L3 Eviction
event.description: Counts the number of L3 evictions.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: L3 Fill Invalid Way
event.description: Counts the number of L3 fills to an invalid way.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: MC Retries
event.description: Counts the number of transactions retried by the memory controller.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: MC Reqs
event.description: Counts the number of requests to the memory controller.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: QOS HH Retry
event.description: Counts the number of times a highest-priority QoS class was retried at the HN-F.

event.title: Clock
event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of instruction or unified cache. Includes the speculative linefills in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. Includes the speculative requests in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. Counts the number of allocations performed in the Data Cache because of a read or a write.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a cache access at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. This includes speculative reads.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. This does not include micro TLB misses because of PLD, PLI, CP15 Cache operation by MVA and CP15 VA to PA operations.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken. Counts the number of exceptions architecturally taken.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Change to ContextID retired. Counts the number of instructions architecturally executed writing into the ContextID register.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted or not predicted. Counts the number of mispredicted or not-predicted branches executed. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branches or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.name: Memory access
event.description: Level 1 data memory access

event.name: L1 inst access
event.description: Level 1 instruction cache access

event.description: Level 1 data cache eviction

event.name: L2 data refill
event.description: Level 2 data cache refill

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data write
event.description: Level 2 data cache write-back. Data transfers made as a result of a coherency request from the Level 2 caches to outside of the Level 1 and Level 2 caches are not counted. Write-backs made as a result of CP15 cache maintenance operations are counted.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: Bus accesses. Single transfer bus accesses on either of the ACE read or write channels might increment twice in one cycle if both the read and write channels are active simultaneously.Operations that utilise the bus that do not explicitly transfer data, such as barrier or coherency operations are counted as bus accesses.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Snoop
event.description: Data snooped from other processor. This event counts memory-read operations that read data from another processor within the local Cortex-A17 cluster, rather than accessing the L2 cache or issuing an external read. It increments on each transaction, rather than on each beat of data.

event.title: Stall
event.name: DPU IP empty
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle that the DPU IQ is empty and that is not because of a recent micro-TLB miss, an instruction cache miss or a pre-decode error.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Cache miss
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle the DPU IQ is empty and there is an instruction cache miss being processed.

event.title: Stall
event.name: TLB miss
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle the DPU IQ is empty and there is an instruction micro-TLB miss being processed.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Pre-decode error
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle the DPU IQ is empty and there is a pre-decode error being processed.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Interlock other
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is not because of an Advanced SIMD or floating-point instruction, and not because of a load/store instruction waiting for data to calculate the address in the AGU. Stall cycles because of a stall in Wr, typically awaiting load data, are excluded.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Interlock address
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is because of a load/store instruction waiting for data to calculate the address in the AGU. Stall cycles because of a stall in Wr, typically awaiting load data, are excluded.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Interlock SIMD/FPU
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is because of an Advanced SIMD or floating-point instruction. Stall cycles because of a stall in the Wr stage, typically awaiting load data, are excluded.

event.name: Load miss
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event Counts every cycle there is a stall in the Wr stage because of a load miss

event.name: Store

event.title: Clock
event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Software increment. The register is incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of instruction or unified cache. Includes the speculative linefills in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. Includes the speculative requests in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. Counts the number of allocations performed in the Data Cache because of a read or a write.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a cache access at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. This includes speculative reads.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. This does not include micro TLB misses because of PLD, PLI, CP15 Cache operation by MVA and CP15 VA to PA operations.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Load
event.description: Data read architecturally executed. Counts the number of data read instructions accepted by the Load Store Unit. This includes counting the speculative and aborted LDR/LDM, and the reads because of the SWP instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Store
event.description: Data write architecturally executed. Counts the number of data write instructions accepted by the Load Store Unit. This includes counting the speculative and aborted STR/STM, and the writes because of the SWP instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken. Counts the number of exceptions architecturally taken.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Change to ContextID retired. Counts the number of instructions architecturally executed writing into the ContextID Register.

event.title: Branch
event.name: PC change
event.description: Software change of PC

event.title: Branch
event.name: Immediate
event.description: Immediate branch architecturally executed (taken or not taken). This includes the branches which are flushed due to a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Procedure return (other than exception returns) architecturally executed

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access
event.description: Unaligned load-store

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted/not predicted. Counts the number of mispredicted or not-predicted branches executed. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branches or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Software increment. The register is incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of instruction or unified cache. Includes the speculative linefills in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. Includes the speculative requests in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. Counts the number of allocations performed in the Data Cache because of a read or a write.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a cache access at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. This includes speculative reads.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. This does not include micro TLB misses because of PLD, PLI, CP15 Cache operation by MVA and CP15 VA to PA operations.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Load
event.description: Data read architecturally executed. Counts the number of data read instructions accepted by the Load Store Unit. This includes counting the speculative and aborted LDR/LDM, and the reads because of the SWP instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Store
event.description: Data write architecturally executed. Counts the number of data write instructions accepted by the Load Store Unit. This includes counting the speculative and aborted STR/STM, and the writes because of the SWP instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken. Counts the number of exceptions architecturally taken.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Change to ContextID retired. Counts the number of instructions architecturally executed writing into the ContextID Register.

event.title: Branch
event.name: PC change
event.description: Software change of PC

event.title: Branch
event.name: Immediate
event.description: Immediate branch architecturally executed (taken or not taken). This includes the branches which are flushed due to a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Procedure return (other than exception returns) architecturally executed

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access
event.description: Unaligned load-store

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted/not predicted. Counts the number of mispredicted or not-predicted branches executed. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branches or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Memory access
event.description: Data memory access

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 inst access
event.description: Instruction Cache access

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 data eviction
event.description: Data cache eviction

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data access
event.description: Level 2 data cache access

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data refill
event.description: Level 2 data cache refill

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data write
event.description: Level 2 data cache write-back. Data transfers made as a result of a coherency request from the Level 2 caches to outside of the Level 1 and Level 2 caches are not counted. Write-backs made as a result of CP15 cache maintenance operations are counted.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: Bus accesses. Single transfer bus accesses on either of the ACE read or write channels might increment twice in one cycle if both the read and write channels are active simultaneously. Operations that utilise the bus that do not explicitly transfer data, such as barrier or coherency operations are counted as bus accesses.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Cycle
event.description: Bus cycle

event.name: Read
event.description: Bus access, read

event.title: Bus
event.name: Write
event.description: Bus access, write

event.name: IRQ
event.description: IRQ exception taken

event.name: FIQ
event.description: FIQ exception taken

event.name: External request
event.description: External memory request

event.title: Memory
event.name: Non-cacheable ext req
event.description: Non-cacheable external memory request

event.title: Cache
event.name: Linefill
event.description: Linefill because of prefetch

event.title: Cache
event.name: Linefill dropped
event.description: Prefetch linefill dropped

event.title: Cache
event.name: Allocate mode enter
event.description: Entering read allocate mode

event.title: Cache
event.name: Allocate mode
event.description: Read allocate mode

event.title: ETM
event.name: ETM Ext Out[0]
event.description: ETM Ext Out[0]

event.title: ETM
event.name: ETM Ext Out[1]
event.description: ETM Ext Out[1]

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Pipeline stall
event.description: Data Write operation that stalls the pipeline because the store buffer is full

event.title: Memory
event.name: Snoop
event.description: Data snooped from other processor. This event counts memory-read operations that read data from another processor within the local Cortex-A7 cluster, rather than accessing the L2 cache or issuing an external read. It increments on each transaction, rather than on each beat of data.

event.title: Clock
event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill at the lowest level of instruction or unified cache. Each instruction fetch from normal cacheable memory that causes a refill from outside of the cache is counted. Accesses that do not cause a new cache refill, but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss are not counted. Where instruction fetches consist of multiple instructions, these accesses count as single events. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative instruction fetches and for fetches of instructions that reach execution.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill at the lowest level of TLB. Each instruction fetch that causes a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching is counted. CP15 TLB maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative instruction fetches and for fetches of instructions that reach execution.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a refill at the lowest level of data or unified cache. Each data read from or write to normal cacheable memory that causes a refill from outside of the cache is counted. Accesses that do not cause a new cache refill, but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss are not counted. Each access to a cache line to normal cacheable memory that causes a new linefill is counted, including the multiple transaction of instructions such as LDM or STM, PUSH and POP. Write-through writes that hit in the cache do not cause a linefill and so are not counted. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a cache access at the lowest level of data or unified cache. Each access to a cache line to normal cacheable memory is counted including the multiple transaction of instructions such as LDM or STM. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a TLB refill at the lowest level of TLB. Each data read or write operation that causes a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching is counted. CP15 TLB maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Load
event.description: Data read architecturally executed. This counter increments for every instruction that explicitly read data, including SWP. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Store
event.description: Data write architecturally executed. The counter increments for every instruction that explicitly wrote data, including SWP. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed. This counter counts for all instructions, including conditional instructions that fail their condition codes.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken. This counts for each exception taken.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Instruction that writes to the Context ID Register architecturally executed. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Branch
event.name: PC change
event.description: Software change of PC, except by an exception, architecturally executed. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Immediate
event.description: Immediate branch architecturally executed, taken or not taken. This includes B{L}, BLX, CB{N}Z, HB{L}, and HBLP. This counter counts for all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed, including conditional instructions that fail their condition codes.

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Procedure return, other than exception returns, architecturally executed. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access
event.description: Unaligned access architecturally executed. This counts each instruction that is an access to an unaligned address. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted or not predicted. This counts for every pipeline flush because of a misprediction from the program flow prediction resources.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branches or other change in the program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Write buffer full
event.description: Any write buffer full cycle

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 store
event.description: Any store that is merged in the L2 memory system

event.title: Cache
event.name: Bufferable transaction
event.description: Any bufferable store transaction from load/store to L2 cache, excluding eviction or cast out data

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 access
event.description: Any accesses to the L2 cache

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 miss
event.description: Any cacheable miss in the L2 cache

event.title: AXI
event.name: Read
event.description: The number of AXI read data transfers

event.title: AXI
event.name: Write
event.description: The number of AXI write data transfers

event.title: Memory
event.name: Replay event
event.description: Any replay event in the memory system

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access replay
event.description: Any unaligned memory access that results in a replay

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 data hash miss
event.description: Any L1 data memory access that misses in the cache as a result of the hashing algorithm. The cases covered are: hash hit and physical address miss, hash hit and physical address hit in another way and hash miss and physical address hit.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 inst hash miss
event.description: Any L1 instruction memory access that misses in the cache as a result of the hashing algorithm. The cases covered are: hash hit and physical address miss, hash hit and physical address hit in another way and hash miss and physical address hit.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 page coloring
event.description: Any L1 data memory access in which a page coloring alias occurs. alias = virtual address [12] ! = physical address [12]. This behavior results in a data memory eviction or cast out.

event.title: NEON
event.name: L1 cache hit
event.description: Any NEON access that hits in the L1 data cache

event.title: NEON
event.name: L1 cache access
event.description: Any NEON cacheable data accesses for L1 data cache

event.title: NEON
event.name: L2 cache access
event.description: Any L2 cache accesses as a result of a NEON memory access

event.title: NEON
event.name: L2 cache hit
event.description: Any NEON hit in the L2 cache

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 inst access
event.description: Any L1 instruction cache access, excluding CP15 cache accesses

event.title: Branch
event.name: Return stack misprediction
event.description: Any return stack misprediction because of incorrect target address for a taken return stack pop

event.title: Branch
event.name: Direction misprediction
event.description: Two forms of branch direction misprediction: branch predicted taken, but was not taken and branch predicted not taken, but was taken

event.title: Branch
event.name: Taken prediction
event.description: Any predictable branch that is predicted to be taken

event.title: Branch
event.name: Executed and taken prediction
event.description: Any predictable branch that is executed and taken

event.title: Core
event.name: Operations issued
event.description: Number of operations issued, where an operation is either: an instruction or one operation in a sequence of operations that make up a multi-cycle instruction

event.title: Core
event.name: No issue cycles
event.description: Increment for every cycle that no instructions are available for issue

event.title: Core
event.name: Issue cycles
event.description: For every cycle, this event counts the number of instructions issued in that cycle. Multi-cycle instructions are only counted once.

event.title: NEON
event.name: MRC data wait
event.description: Number of cycles the processor stalls waiting on MRC data from NEON

event.title: NEON
event.name: Full queue
event.description: Number of cycles that the processor stalls as a result of a full NEON instruction queue or NEON load queue

event.title: NEON
event.name: Idle
event.description: Number of cycles that NEON and integer processors are both not idle

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[0]
event.description: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[0]

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[1]
event.description: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[1]

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[0,1]
event.description: Counts any event from both external input sources PMUEXTIN[0] and PMUEXTIN[1]

event.title: Clock
event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill of at least the level of instruction or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill of at least the level of TLB closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a refill of at least the level of data or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a cache access to at least the level of data or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the level of TLB closest to the processor

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Load
event.description: Memory-reading instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Store
event.description: Memory-writing instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Instruction that writes to the CONTEXTIDR architecturally executed

event.title: Branch
event.name: PC change
event.description: Software change of the Program Counter, except by an exception, architecturally executed

event.title: Branch
event.name: Immediate
event.description: Immediate branch architecturally executed

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access
event.description: Unaligned access architecturally executed

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted or not predicted

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branch or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor

event.title: Java
event.name: Bytecode execute
event.description: Counts the number of Java bytecodes being decoded, including speculative ones

event.title: Java
event.name: SW bytecode execute
event.description: Counts the number of software Java bytecodes being decoded, including speculative ones

event.title: Jazelle
event.name: Backward branch execute
event.description: Counts the number of Jazelle taken branches being executed. This includes the branches that are flushed because of a previous load/store that aborts late.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Coherency miss
event.description: Counts the number of coherent linefill requests performed by the Cortex-A9 processor that also miss in all the other Cortex-A9 processors. This means that the request is sent to the external memory.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Coherency hit
event.description: Counts the number of coherent linefill requests performed by the Cortex-A9 processor that hit in another Cortex-A9 processor. This means that the linefill data is fetched directly from the relevant Cortex-A9 cache.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst dependent stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor: is ready to accept new instructions, does not receive a new instruction, because: the instruction side is unable to provide one or the instruction cache is performing at least one linefill

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data dependent stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor has some instructions that it cannot issue to any pipeline, and the Load Store unit has at least one pending linefill request, and no pending TLB requests

event.title: Cache
event.name: TLB stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor is stalled waiting for the completion of translation table walks from the main TLB. The processor stalls because the instruction side is not able to provide the instructions, or the data side is not able to provide the necessary data.

event.title: Intrinsic
event.name: STREX pass
event.description: Counts the number of STREX instructions architecturally executed and passed

event.title: Intrinsic
event.name: STREX fail
event.description: Counts the number of STREX instructions architecturally executed and failed

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data eviction
event.description: Counts the number of eviction requests because of a linefill in the data cache

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Issue stage no dispatch
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the issue stage does not dispatch any instruction because it is empty or cannot dispatch any instructions

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Issue stage empty
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the issue stage is empty

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Counts the number of instructions going through the Register Renaming stage. This number is an approximate number of the total number of instructions speculatively executed, and an even more approximate number of the total number of instructions architecturally executed. The approximation depends mainly on the branch misprediction rate.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data linefills
event.description: Counts the number of linefills performed on the external AXI bus. This event counts all data linefill requests, caused by: loads, including speculative ones, stores, PLD, prefetch or page table walk.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Prefetch linefills
event.description: Counts the number of data linefills caused by prefetcher requests

event.title: Cache
event.name: Prefetch hits
event.description: Counts the number of cache hits in a line that belongs to a stream followed by the prefetcher. This includes: lines that have been prefetched by the automatic data prefetcher and lines already present in the cache, before the prefetcher action.

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Counts the number of procedure returns whose condition codes do not fail, excluding all returns from exception. This count includes procedure returns that are flushed because of a previous load/store that aborts late.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Main execution unit
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the main execution pipeline of the processor, the multiply pipeline and arithmetic logic unit pipeline. The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Second execution unit
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the processor second execution pipeline (ALU). The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the Load/Store unit. The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Floating point
event.description: Counts the number of floating-point instructions going through the Register Rename stage. Instructions are still speculative in this stage.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: NEON
event.description: Counts the number of NEON instructions going through the Register Rename stage. Instructions are still speculative in this stage.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: PLD
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor is stalled because PLD slots are all full

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Memory write
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the processor is stalled. The data side is stalled also, because it is full and executes writes to the external memory.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Inst main TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of main TLB misses on requests issued by the instruction side

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Data main TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of main TLB misses on requests issued by the data side

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Inst micro TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of micro TLB misses on the instruction side. This event does not include main TLB miss stall cycles that are already counted in the corresponding main TLB event.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Data micro TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of micro TLB misses on the data side. This event does not include main TLB miss stall cycles that are already counted in the corresponding main TLB event.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: DMB
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of the execution of a DMB. This includes all DMB instructions being executed, even speculatively.

event.title: Clock
event.name: Integer core
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the integer core clock is enabled

event.title: Clock
event.name: Data engine
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the data engine clock is enabled

event.title: Clock
event.name: NEON
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the NEON SIMD clock is enabled

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB inst allocations
event.description: Counts the number of TLB allocations because of Instruction requests

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB data allocations
event.description: Counts the number of TLB allocations because of Data requests

event.title: Instruction
event.name: ISB
event.description: Counts the number of ISB instructions architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DSB
event.description: Counts the number of DSB instructions architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DMB
event.description: Counts the number of DMB instructions speculatively executed

event.title: External
event.name: Interrupts
event.description: Counts the number of external interrupts executed by the processor

event.title: PLE
event.name: Cache line rq completed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE cache line requests completed

event.title: PLE
event.name: Cache line rq skipped
event.description: Counts the number of PLE cache line requests skipped

event.title: PLE
event.name: FIFO flush
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush requests

event.title: PLE
event.name: Request completed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush completed

event.title: PLE
event.name: FIFO overflow
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush overflowed

event.title: PLE
event.name: Request programmed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush program requests

event.title: Clock
event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction cache miss
event.description: Each instruction fetch from normal cacheable memory that causes a refill from the L2 memory system generates this event. Accesses that do not cause a new cache refill, but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss are not counted.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data cache miss
event.description: Each data read from or write to normal cacheable memory that causes a refill from the L2 memory system generates this event. Accesses that do not cause a new cache refill, but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss are not counted.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Each access to a cache line is counted including the multiple transactions of an LDM, STM, or other operations. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events

event.title: Data
event.name: Data Read
event.description: Data Read architecturally executed. This event occurs for every instruction that explicitly reads data, including SWP.

event.title: Data
event.name: Data Write
event.description: Data Write architecturally executed. This event occurs for every instruction that explicitly writes data, including SWP.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Instruction Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Dual-issued Pair Executed
event.description: Dual-issued pair of instructions architecturally executed.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: This event occurs on each exception taken.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed. This event occurs on every exception return.

event.title: Context ID
event.name: Change
event.description: Change to Context ID executed.

event.title: Program Counter
event.name: SW change
event.description: Software changed the PC, except by an exception, architecturally executed.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Instruction executed
event.description: B immediate, BL immediate or BLX immediate instruction architecturally executed (taken or not taken).

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Returns
event.description: Procedure return architecturally executed, other than exception returns, for example, BZ Rm, LDM Rn, {..,PC}.

event.title: Access
event.name: Unaligned
event.description: This event occurs for each instruction that was to an unaligned address that either triggered an alignment fault, or would have done so if the SCTLR A-bit had been set.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted or not predicted.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Predicted
event.description: Branches or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor.

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Instruction stall
event.description: Stall because instruction buffer cannot deliver an instruction. This can indicate an instruction cache miss. This event occurs every cycle where the condition is present.

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Dependency stall
event.description: Stall because of a data dependency between instructions. This event occurs every cycle where the condition is present.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: Data cache write-back. This event occurs once for each line that is written back from the cache.

event.title: External
event.name: Access
event.description: External memory request. Examples of this are cache refill, Non-cacheable accesses, write-through writes, cache line evictions (write-back).

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: LSU busy
event.description: Stall because of LSU being busy. This event takes place each clock cycle where the condition is met. A high incidence of this event indicates the pipeline is often waiting for transactions to complete on the external bus.

event.title: Store Buffer
event.name: Drains
event.description: Store buffer was forced to drain completely. Examples of this are DMB, Strongly-ordered memory access, or similar events.

event.title: Interrupt
event.name: FIQ Disabled
event.description: The number of cycles FIQ interrupts are disabled.

event.title: Store Buffer
event.name: IRQ Disabled
event.description: The number of cycles IRQ interrupts are disabled.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst tag or parity error
event.description: Instruction cache tag RAM parity or correctable ECC error.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst parity error
event.description: Instruction cache data RAM parity or correctable ECC error.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data tag or parity error
event.description: Data cache tag or dirty RAM parity error or correctable ECC error.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data parity error
event.description: Data cache data RAM parity error or correctable ECC error

event.title: TCM
event.name: Error Prefetch
event.description: TCM fatal ECC error reported from the prefetch unit.

event.title: TCM
event.name: Error Load/Store
event.description: TCM fatal ECC error reported from the load/store unit.

event.title: Store Buffer
event.name: Merge
event.description: Store buffer merge.

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: LSU store buffer full
event.description: LSU stall caused by full store buffer.

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: LSU store queue full
event.description: LSU stall caused by store queue full.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Integer divide
event.description: Integer divide instruction, SDIV or UDIV, executed.

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Integer divide stall
event.description: Stall cycle caused by integer divide.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Linefill initiated
event.description: PLD instruction that initiates a linefill.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Linefill not initiated
event.description: PLD instruction that did not initiate a linefill because of a resource shortage.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Non-cachable access
event.description: Non-cacheable access on AXI master bus.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction cache access
event.description: Instruction cache access. This is an analog to event 0x04 (Data / Cache Access)

event.title: Cache
event.name: Two slots data
event.description: Store buffer operation has detected that two slots have data in same cache line but with different attributes.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Dual issue case A
event.description: Dual issue case A (branch).

event.title: Branch
event.name: Dual issue case B1, B2, F2, F2D
event.description: Dual issue case B1, B2, F2 (load/store), F2D.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Dual issue other
event.description: Dual issue other case.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Double arithmetic
event.description: Double precision floating point arithmetic or conversion instruction executed.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data ECC error
event.description: Data cache data RAM fatal ECC error.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Tag/dirty ECC error
event.description: Data cache tag/dirty RAM fatal ECC error.

event.title: Processor
event.name: Livelock
event.description: Processor livelock because of hard errors or exception at exception vector.

event.title: ATCM
event.name: Multi-bit error
event.description: ATCM multi-bit ECC error.

event.title: B0TCM
event.name: Multi-bit error
event.description: B0TCM multi-bit ECC error.

event.title: B1TCM
event.name: Multi-bit error
event.description: B1TCM multi-bit ECC error.

event.title: ATCM
event.name: Single-bit error
event.description: ATCM single-bit ECC error.

event.title: B0TCM
event.name: Single-bit error
event.description: B0TCM single-bit ECC error.

event.title: B1TCM
event.name: Single-bit error
event.description: B1TCM single-bit ECC error.

event.title: TCM
event.name: Load/Store error
event.description: TCM correctable ECC error reported by load/store unit.

event.title: TCM
event.name: Prefetch error
event.description: TCM correctable ECC error reported by prefetch unit.

event.title: TCM
event.name: AXI slave fatal error
event.description: TCM fatal ECC error reported by AXI slave interface.

event.title: TCM
event.name: AXI slave error
event.description: TCM correctable ECC error reported by AXI slave interface.

event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill of at least the level of instruction or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill of at least the level of TLB closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a refill of at least the level of data or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a cache access to at least the level of data or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the level of TLB closest to the processor

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: CastOUT
event.description: Eviction, CastOUT, of a line from the L2 cache

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Data Read Hit
event.description: Data read hit in the L2 cache

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Data Read Request
event.description: Data read lookup to the L2 cache. Subsequently results in a hit or miss

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Data Write Hit
event.description: Data write hit in the L2 cache

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Data Write Request
event.description: Data write lookup to the L2 cache. Subsequently results in a hit or miss

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Data Write-Through Request
event.description: Data write lookup to the L2 cache with Write-Through attribute. Subsequently results in a hit or miss

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Instruction Read Hit
event.description: Instruction read hit in the L2 cache

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Instruction Read Request
event.description: Instruction read lookup to the L2 cache. Subsequently results in a hit or miss

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Write Allocate Miss
event.description: Allocation into the L2 cache caused by a write, with Write-Allocate attribute, miss

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Internal Prefetch Allocate
event.description: Allocation of a prefetch generated by L2C-310 into the L2 cache

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Prefetch Hit
event.description: Prefetch hint hits in the L2 cache

event.title: L2 Cache
event.name: Prefetch Allocate
event.description: Prefetch hint allocated into the L2 cache

event.name: Speculative Read Received

event.title: Memory
event.name: Used
event.description: Total used memory size. Note: a process' used memory includes shared memory that may be counted more than once (equivalent to RES from top). Kernel threads are not filterable.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Used
event.description: Total used memory size

event.title: Memory
event.name: Free
event.description: Available memory size

event.title: Memory
event.name: Buffer
event.description: Memory used by OS disk buffers, included in Memory: Used

event.title: Memory
event.name: Cached
event.description: Memory used by OS disk cache, included in Memory: Used

event.name: Slab
event.description: Memory used by the kernel, included in Memory: Used

event.name: Frequency
event.description: Frequency setting of the CPU

event.name: Wait
event.description: One or more threads are runnable but waiting due to CPU contention

event.name: Wait
event.description: One or more threads are blocked on an I/O resource

event.name: System
event.description: Linux System activity
